src:
Dež in megla nista ustavila gorskega teka treh vrhov
03 Nov 2019, 10:10 by Igor Mušič

Sinoči se je s prihodom tekačev s čelnimi svetilkami na cilj v Solkanu končal tretji čezmejni mednarodni gorski tek treh vrhov. Kraljevsko preizkušnjo na 58 kilometrov sta dobila Ivan Hrastovec in Urša Trobec.



Zmagovalec teka na 28 kilometrov Janez Žen iz Budanj Foto: Igor Mušič

SOLKAN > Javni zavod za šport Nova Gorica in goriški tekaški zanesenjak Miha Repič sta na tretjo izvedbo mednarodnega čezmejnega teka po poteh treh vrhov prve svetovne vojne (to so Škabrijel, Sveta Gora in Sabotin) privabila 336 gorskih tekačev iz sedmih držav.


Organizator Miha Repič

Udeležencem so bili na voljo trije teki. Najzahtevnejši je na 58 kilometrih tekače utrujal še z 2864 višinskimi metri vzponov in s prav takšno količino spustov. Tekači so na tej preizkušnji morali med Škabrijelom in Sabotinom preteči še nekakšno veliko podkev: ves rob Banjške planote do Kanalskega vrha, se spustiti v dolino Soče in se nato dvigniti na najvišjo točko teka, dobrih 800 metrov visoko Korado, ter se nato vračati proti Solkanu. Na poti so se morali spoprijeti tudi s plazenjem skozi kaverne in z veslanjem čez Sočo.


Tekmovalci so se morali med drugim spoprijeti tudi z veslanjem čez Sočo.

Kljub dolgi in zahtevni poti, vetru, dežju in megli so na najdaljši progi odstopili le štirje tekači, zmagal pa je prekaljeni štajerski gorski ultramaratonec Ivan Hrastovec z Vranskega, ki je s progo opravi v šestih urah, minuti in devetih sekundah. Izvrstno se je odrezal član društva Postojna teče Andrej Lindič, ki je osvojil absolutno drugo mesto s časom 6:55,49.


Zmagovalna moška trojica teka na 58 kilometrov

Ženska zmaga je šla na Gorenjsko. Slavila je članica Kluba gorskih tekačev Papež iz Kamnika Urša Trobec (8:11,16), srebro pa si je priborila Tolminka Tina Medved (ŠD Soške elektrarne, 8:40,45).


Zmagovalna ženska trojica teka na 58 kilometrov

Tek na 28 km je postregel s 1672 metri višinske razlike vzponov in spustov. Tudi na tej preizkušnji je marsikoga ujela tema, zahteval pa je šest odstopov. Tudi na tej progi so bili primorski tekači izvrstni, saj je absolutno zmagal Janez Žen iz Budanj, ki je v cilj pritekel po dveh urah 48 minutah in 52 sekundah. Dokaj prepričljivo je ugnal prvega zasledovalca Aleša Debeljaka iz ŠD Ljubljanske mlekarne (2: 52,24).
V ženski konkurenci so vse stopničke zmagovalnega odra zasedle Primorke. Zmagala je Kristina Kržišnik (3:44,10) pred Asto Gregorič (3:48,37) in Tino Oberstar (3: 52,46).


Zmagovalna ženska trojica teka na 28 kilometrov

Tek na 12 kilometrov s 600 metri višinske razlike je dobil član KD Brda Matic Plaznik, ki je bil v cilju v manj kot uri (57,58). Drugo mesto je osvojil Ajdovec Elis Filipič (59,44). V ženski konkurenci je bila najhitrejša Nika Mazi iz okolice Ljubljane (1:13,48), najboljši primorski dosežek pa je s tretjim mestom prispevala Vipavka Kristina Vanceta (1: 19,33).



Zmagovalec teka na 28 kilometrov Janez Žen iz Budanj Foto: Igor Mušič



Nika Mazi je bila najhitrejša med ženskimi udeleženkami teka na 12 kilometrov Foto: Igor Mušič



Ajdovec Elis Filipič je osvojil drugo mesto med moškimi na teku na 12 kilometrov Foto: Igor Mušič



Foto: Igor Mušič



Foto: Igor Mušič
text:
The rain and fog did not stop the mountain running of the three peaks
03 Nov 2019, 09:10 by Igor Mušič

Last night, with the arrival of runners with headlights on target in Solkan, the third cross-border international mountain race of the three summits ended. The 58-kilometer royal trial was won by Ivan Hrastovec and Urša Trobec.



The winner of the 28 km run is Janez Žen from Budanj. Photo: Igor Mušič

SOLKAN> The Nova Gorica Sports Institute and Miha Repič, a cross-country cross-country runner, attracted 336 mountain runners from seven countries to the third international cross-border race along the routes of the three World War I summits (Skabriel, Sveta Gora and Sabotin).


Organized by Miha Repic

Participants were offered three runs. The most demanding of all, at 58 kilometers, the runners tired with 2864 altitude meters of ascents and the same amount of descents. The runners had to pass some kind of horseshoe between Skabriel and Sabotin: the entire edge of the Banjska plateau to the Channel top, descend into the Soča valley and then ascend to the highest point of the run, a good 800 meters high Korada, and then return to Solkan . Along the way, they also had to crawl through the caverns and paddle across the Soča River.


The competitors had to tackle rowing across the Soča River, among other things.

Despite the long and demanding route, wind, rain and fog, only four runners took the longest route, and the victorious Styrian mountain ultramarathoner Ivan Hrastovec from Vransko won the race in six hours, minutes and nine seconds. The postojna running member Andrej Lindič, who finished in absolute second place with a time of 6: 55,49, excelled.


The winning men's three runs at 58 miles

The women's victory went to the Gorenjska region. The member of the Mountain Runners Club Pope from Kamnik was celebrated by Urša Trobec (8: 11,16), and silver was won by Tolminka Tina Medved (ŠD Soške elektrarne, 8: 40,45).


The winning women's three runs at 58 miles

At 28 km, the elevation and descent difference was 1,672 meters. In this trial too, many were caught up in the topic, demanding six resignations. The coastal runners were excellent on this route as well, as Janez Zhen from Budanj absolutely won, reaching the finish line after two hours 48 minutes and 52 seconds. Quite convincingly, he chased away the first pursuer, Ales Debeljak, from the Ljubljana Dairy (2: 52.24).
In the women's competition, all podium stages were occupied by Primorka. Kristina Kržišnik (3: 44,10) won against Asto Gregorič (3: 48,37) and Tina Oberstar (3: 52,46).


The winning women's three runs at 28 miles

The 12 km distance with 600 meters of altitude difference was given to KD Brda member Matic Plaznik, who was in the target in less than an hour (57.58). Second place went to Ajdovec Elis Filipič (59.44). The fastest Nika Mazi from the Ljubljana area (1: 13.48) was the fastest in the women's competition, with Kristin Vancet (1: 19.33) Vipavka with the third place.



The winner of the 28 km run is Janez Žen from Budanj. Photo: Igor Mušič



Nika Mazi was the fastest female runner at 12 km Photo: Igor Mušič



Ajdovec's Elis Filipic finished second in the men's 12 km race Photo: Igor Mušič
